newsitem.title: USA: Lycos, Blockbuster in Internet venture.
newsitem.headline: Lycos, Blockbuster in Internet venture.

text.p: Lycos Inc and Viacom Inc's Blockbuster Entertainment said on Friday they had formed a new Internet navigational site to bring entertainment news and information to online users worldwide.

The companies said the site, located at http://www.blockbuster.com/passport, is being introduced at over 3,200 Blockbuster video and music stores in the U.S. through the distribution of 1.5 million copies of Sprint Corp's Internet Passport software.
The site, which uses Lycos technology, will provide online users with the latest news about the stars, entertainment events and products.
Blockbuster has also entered into a relationship with Starwave, a leading producer and publisher of online content, owned by Microsoft Corp cofounder Paul Allen, the companies said.
Starwave will provide Blockbuster with links to entertainment news information from its Mr. Showbiz site, the companies said.
